summary: Got tired of supplying my own cork texture for house mods, and since I like this one better than what is available, perhaps someone else might enjoy it.
descriptionHtml:
I use this cork texture a lot in my house mods (and privately). So, rather than replacing every single cork mesh in my clutters with this texture, I'd rather publish this as a general replacement, and have meshes in my home point to vanilla texture in the "effects" folder. 


When I work with cork textures I have a habit of turning off SLSF1_Specular in nifskope, and this texture looks best when this option is off. 
Almost all Skyrim meshes have this turned on, and while it looks great for metal surfaces, it can look weird for soft, porous materials like soft-wood, cork or cloth. 

For modding purposes, this is a seamless texture, so you can multiply its coverage in individual nif meshes. It looks good on a 1:1 basis, but scales up well up to 1:4. (for a 512k texture quality; the cork texture in this mod is 128x128).

[color=#ead1dc]
SOURCE[/color]

[color=#d5a6bd]www.sketchuptextureclub.com[/color]
author: Orin_Linwe
